subject: Art
title: Value in Color
description: How light or dark a color is â€” the most important property.

hook.text: Yellow is naturally light. Purple is naturally dark. Every color has an inherent value â€” and understanding this is more important than knowing any color scheme.

buildup.text: Value: the lightness or darkness of a color. Adding white creates a tint (lighter value). Adding black creates a shade (darker value). Adding gray creates a tone (changes both value and saturation).

discovery.text: Different hues have different natural values. Yellow is the lightest hue. Violet is the darkest. If you make yellow as dark as violet, it turns greenish-brown. Each hue has a natural value range.

twist.text: A colorful painting with wrong values looks flat and confusing. A grayscale painting with correct values looks solid and three-dimensional. Value trumps color every single time.

climax.text: Test: photograph your colorful artwork and convert to grayscale. If the image reads well in black and white, your values are correct. If areas merge together, fix the values.

punchline.text: Color gets the glory. Value does the work. Always check value first.

quiz.question: What is a 'tint' of a color?
options: The color mixed with white (lighter value)
